feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Transporting Deleted Teams from Test to Production in SAP SAC
entry.content:
Dear Team,

As part of our recent housekeeping activity, we identified several unused Teams in  SAP Analytics Cloud  and have deleted them in the Test environment. To maintain consistency across systems, I would like to transport these deletions to the Production environment.

Could anyone please guide me through the steps required to perform this transport? Specifically, I want to ensure that all Teams deleted in Test are also removed in Production following the transport process.

Thank you for your support.

Regards,
Om Pandya

entry.title: SAC date filters
entry.content:
A challenge that we're having is that we'd like to simplify how report consumers can apply date filters in our dashboards.  
We are using an SAC analytic model with acquired data. 
 
What we ideally would like to do:
  1. Give the end user the ability to have a date range filter as a Story filter.  
  2. Have that date filter work for metrics (1) that are logical to count over a date range (easy) and (2) other metrics that only expect a single month (and will crash if they don't receive a single month).  The metric that crashes uses the RESTRICT function to calculate a rolling-12 month count in a numeric point widget. 
  3. We'd like to set the default date filter end date to be the last completed refresh date, which we can access in our Modeler data.  The default date filter start date would then be set to [end date - 24 months]. 
We've accomplished some of the above (point 3) with some page-level scripting and page filters but the holy grail here is a Story filter so users wouldn't need to change a page filter on each page. 
 
Does anyone have some creative thoughts on how to do this? 
 
 Thanks!

entry.title: SAC subtotal challenges
entry.content:
We've run into a couple of challenges with the SUBTOTAL function.

For context, we are using an SAC analytic model.   

  1. We're using the SUBTOTAL function to get percents of totals but there is a 10 dimension limit.  Does anyone  know of an alternative that does not have that limit? 
  2. We've tried to use SUBTOTAL on an aggregated measure (we aggregated it in the Model), but it failed.  Is this expected?  

Thanks for your help!

entry.title: Error while exporting the model in SAC
entry.content:
Hi SAP Folks,

In SAP Analytics Cloud, I encountered one issue while exporting Classic Account Model. It is one time activity. So no export job is required. I created the model using a flat file. Then i needed to export the model as file. 

In the model only 1002 rows are there. Even I filtered out some more columns, so less data should be exported.

But i am getting issue: 
Correlation ID: 3809068113254091b130416369762251

I tried after clearing the google cache and even tried on incognito mode also. But no help!

The SAC version is Advanced trial one.

Kindly help folk! 

Thank you.

entry.title: Question about Capacity Unit Estimation for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning Professional Users
entry.content:
hi, expert 

I am currently using the Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Business Data Cloud (https://bdc-pricing-estimator-sac-sacus10.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/).

I would like to estimate the required capacity units for SAP Analytics Cloud Planning Professional users. According to the estimator, a Planning Standard user requires 72.85 CU per user, whereas a Planning Professional user requires 820.43 CU per user.

Is this correct?
Is the Planning Professional user really that much more expensive?

I would like to use the Professional license for its features, but the budget may not allow it.
What are my options if I need the functionalities of the Professional license but my budget is insufficient?

Thank you in advance for your advice.

entry.title: Error when querying a SAC story that consumes data from an analytical model in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are currently experiencing issues running SAC stories that consume SAP Datasphere analytical models. This issue has arisen during this summer. We have already created a SAP CASE, but we haven’t received any solution yet . For now, expanding the SAP Datasphere parameters is ruled out due to its extra cost.

We would appreciate any help to unblock this problem. The issue is that the execution time of SAC stories has increased significantly (there hasn’t been any notable increase in data), and in the worst cases, the report execution ends with a timeout (we are aware of the 3-minute limitation).

What concerns us is that the SAC report only displays a table with about 20,000 records. The analytical model consumes a view that is persisted. Furthermore, there are no other processes running in parallel, and the number of SAC executions is minimal.

The error message is:

"code":"inaTimeout","details":{"stack":"See correlation id ada620af-5346-439b-5037-5292cab57589","message":"execution aborted by timeout, Code: 613, SQL State: HY000","code":613,"sqlState":"HY000","name":"HanaError","originalMessage":"execution aborted by timeout"}}

The note related to SAC Timeout is:

0003584795 - Timeout Issue with Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere

Thanks in advance.

Regards,

Miquel

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud session cookies remain after corporate IdP logout
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community!

currently we are facing an issue with our SAP Analytics Cloud, or rather the session management of the product. We created different stories in our SAC which we embedded in our corporate environment so our customers and employees can use them. This is done via iFrame. 

Our SAC has an Cloud Identity Instance as an IdP configured while the Cloud Identity Instance uses a Microsoft based corporate IdP where all SSO requests are forwarded. 

Now for the actual issue: After user A logs initiates a logoff in the corporate environment the session is terminated and the user is forwared to the login page again. But if user B does a login the SAC still has the session cookes from user A active and no further authentication flow is triggered. This means that user B works with the SAC user A until the browser is actually closed (since that is the cookie lifetime) 

We were under the impression that when the corporate IdP terminates the session, the Cloud Identity Service "tells" the Analytics Cloud to delete the session + cookies as well. 

Does anybody have a similar experience with SAC integrations via iFrame?

entry.title: SAC - Problem with Excel Data Model User Access
entry.content:
Hi,

I have created a data model of an uploaded MS Excel file. I granted my colleague Full Controll Access, but he cannot maintain the data model. He cannot Delete Facts and also Set Up the Import Job. Is it possible that only the Owner has Access to this functions?

BR

entry.title: SAC Story: How to filter a chart on another page based on pie-chart segment selection?
entry.content:
Hi SAC 

I am working on an SAC Story with two separate pages:

  • Page 1: A pie chart showing Material-wise values

  • Page 2: A column chart showing monthly values (Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr...) for each material

I want this behavior:

When a user selects a segment of the pie chart on Page 1 (i.e., selects a Material or multiple material), the column chart on Page 2 should automatically update and show the corresponding monthly values for that selected material.

Keeping both charts on the same page is not an option in my case.

Is there any way to achieve this in an SAC Story—either through Linked Analysis, Story Filters, Input Controls, or any other method?
If this is only possible through scripting, please help me with the script. 

 

Thank you

entry.title: SAC - Update Dimension Values in a Planning Model Without Deleting Transaction Data (ID changed)
entry.content:
Dear Community
I’m working with a SAC planning model that includes a dimension called ProductID. In our legacy system, products were stored with older IDs (product A). In our new system, these same products now have updated IDs (ABC).

I would like to update the ProductID values in the dimension so that all existing transactional data reflects the new product IDs. However, I want to avoid deleting and reloading all the transactional data that has already been imported (using an upload job).

My question: Is there a way in SAC to replace old dimension member IDs with new ones without removing the existing transactional data? For example, can ProductID “A” be changed to “ABC” in a way that automatically updates all related transaction records?

Any guidance, workarounds would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Create Ranking Bucket in SAC Story Chart
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a business requirement to create ranking buckets in an SAC Story chart. While the built-in ranking function allows the creation of Top/Bottom-N rankings, it does not provide a way to define custom ranking buckets.

Is there a method to achieve this—either through a calculated measure or dimension, or by using scripting? A sample chart is attached for reference.

Ranking buckets we are looking for-

Ranking BucketTotal Amount
Rank 1XXX.xx
Rank 2-5XXX.xx
Rank 6-10XXX.xx
Rank 11-20XXX.xx
All OtherXXX.xx

entry.title: [SAC] Minor inconvenience on responsive functionnality since the update. Bug or intended ?
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I have been working on making my reports responsive recently, and since the last update, I encounter a little issue, which I wanted to share with you, in order to have more information about it, or if it is not intended, simply report that this exists.

When you are in the builder panel of your section, working to adapt the size of your widget, you have the possibility to switch from 'Free' to 'Auto-Flow'. 

My issue comes up when you want to add a widget in the 'Widget Width' or 'Height' section. In free mode, you can 'Add widget', and then you have a Drop-down panel to choose the widget you wish to adapt.  And as long as I remember, it always worked like this. 

 

 

But now, when I switch to Auto-flow, the drop-down still exists, but does not allow me to select other widgets, so I have to add all my widgets first, and then adapt the sizes.

 

 

I don't know if this was intended, but I find it a bit annoying since the report updates only when all fields are filled in.

Let me know if you face the same problem, and if anyone has information about it, I would be really interested !

Have a nice day,

Julien Dorffer

entry.title: How can AI agents be integrated with SAP BTP to automate student support and academic workflows
entry.content:
How can AI agents be integrated with SAP BTP to automate student support and academic workflows in higher education?

I’m exploring the use of AI agents for higher education and want to understand how SAP technologies can support this.
Has anyone implemented AI agents or intelligent automation on SAP BTP, SAP Analytics Cloud, or SAP S/4HANA for university operations?

I’m interested in learning how AI agents can help with:

Automating student inquiries

Enhancing academic workflow management

Integrating with LMS/SIS platforms

Predictive analytics for student success

Improving administrative efficiency on campus

What are the recommended SAP services, integration patterns, or best practices for deploying AI agents securely and at scale in a higher education environment?

entry.title: sac advanced formula - searching for the right record in a linked model in a foreach statement
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an advanced formula that needs to find a specific record in a linked model.

Here is example data for both models:

The main model contains hours per month, employees, and PSP.

Date

FCMONTH

PERSONAL

PARAMETER

PSPELEMENT

BMOT

DESTINATION

VTYPE

HOURS

REVENUE

202501

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

83

 

202503

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

100

 

2025010

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

60

 

2025011

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

75

 

202501

000000

101

101

235.02

I1

#

020

110

 

202504

000000

101

101

235.02

I1

#

020

43

 

202501

000000

102

101

235.02

I1

#

020

24

 

The linked model contains the hourly rates for employees, PSP, and valid from month

Date

VALIDFROM

PSPELEMENT

PERSONAL

PARAMETER

BMOT

DESTINATION

AMOUNT

000000

202501

235.02

100

1

I1

#

165

000000

202510

235.02

100

1

I1

#

180

000000

202501

235.02

101

1

I1

#

165

000000

202501

235.02

102

1

I1

#

165

My formula looks as follows:

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/PSPELEMENT] = BASEMEMBER([d/PSPELEMENT].[h/PSPHIER], %PSPElemBaseMember%)
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = %STARTDATUM% TO %ENDDATUM%
MEMBERSET [d/Parametertyp] = "100"
MEMBERSET [d/VTYPE] = %VTYPE%
MEMBERSET [d/PERSONAL] = %Mitarbeiter%

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MODEL [APC_BASIC_DATA]
ENDMODEL

FOREACH [d/PERSONAL], [APC_BASIC_DATA].[d/VALIDFROM] ASC
	IF DATEDIFF([d/Date], [APC_BASIC_DATA].[d/VALIDFROM], "MONTH") >= 0 THEN
		IF LINK([APC_BASIC_DATA], [d/Measures] = "Betrag", [d/PSPELEMENT] = %PSPElemQuelle%, [d/Parametertyp] = "1", [d/Version] = "public.Actual", [d/Date] = "000000") > 0 THEN

			DATA([d/Measures] = "Umsatz") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "STUNDEN") * LINK([APC_BASIC_DATA], [d/Measures] = "Betrag", [d/PSPELEMENT] = %PSPElemQuelle%, [d/Parametertyp] = "1", [d/Version] = "public.Actual", [d/Date] = "000000")

		ENDIF
	ENDIF
ENDFOR

The purpose of this function is to find the correct hourly rate for each data record in the main model and then to calculate the revenue.

The FOREACH should check for each employee and validfrom whether the month of the current record in the main model is greater than or equal to the validfrom month of the linked model. By sorting in ascending order, I ensure that the hourly rate with the largest validfrom month is calculated last and that each hour is calculated with the correct hourly rate.

The problem is that the LINK command within the FOREACH does not take the validfrom value of the current iteration. It seems as if it takes the aggregation of all hourly rates for an employee.

How can I specify the filter for the validfrom dimension of the current iteration in the LINK command?

Thanks in advance.

Kind regards,
Max

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud: Assertion Failed could not find translatable text
entry.content:
Hi All,

A client of mine is experiencing a UI issue in their SAC tenants. See below.

When looking, this is the case for multiple users. Although my user is not experiencing it. Potentially because I am using a different network and security setup than the client. 

When opening console, I get large number of the following error: Assertion Failed Could not find translatable text.

Any suggestions as to what is causing this and how to fix, would be much appreciated.

Thanks,

Charles

entry.title: Using SAC, create a hierarchical structure that has the same GLAccount number
entry.content:
Using SAC, create a hierarchical structure that has the same GLAccount number for the GLAccountHierarchy and ParentNode columns.

When trying to load data into the Modeler Model using SAC, the hierarchical structure defined is GLAccountHierarchy --> ParentNode --> GLAccount.

The data listed in GLAccountHiearchywithParentandAccount.txt should be used. The data load is not functioning properly because multiple GLAccounts have the same GLAccountHierarchy and ParentNode column values. 

How can I resolve this issue? What is the process for creating a GL Account Hierarchy structure with this data?

Thanks again.

entry.title: Inventory Aging in SAC story , using the User Input Date from Datasphere Analytical Model
entry.content:
Hi

I am working in an SAC Story and need to create dynamic inventory aging buckets using LIFO method.

 The  Analytical mode  is from DataSphere is having the User Input Date, which is prompted in SAC while executing the Story.

Example:

  • Material:  ABC

  • Closing Stock: 100 Qty (as on the User Input Date : 15/Nov/2025)

  • Purchases done :

    • 25 Qty purchased on 31/Oct/2025 ( 15 days ago)

    • 200 Qty purchased on 31/Oct/2024 ( 1 Year ago)

Expected Aging Output (all slabs):

Aging Slab (Days) Quantity
0–3025
31–600
61–900
91–1200
>12175
Total100

Challenge:
The User Input Date comes from the Datasphere model ( we not using the Planning Model), and I am unable to capture this date inside SAC formulas to dynamically calculate the aging buckets.

The Total of all the Aging bucket should not be more than the Closing Inventory Available!

Any guidance, would be greatly appreciated.

This type of logic was easy to achieve in BEx Query Designer by using MIN, MAX, and SIGN functions, but I’m finding it difficult to replicate in SAC.
